alert.note: Alert for Dorchester (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 7:15PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Dorchester County through 745 PM EDT... At 715 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles west of Oxford, or 12 miles east of Breezy Point, moving southeast at 20 mph. Doppler radar has indicated weak rotation with this storm. While a tornado is not immediately likely, remain alert for any warnings. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... University Of Maryland Center For Environmental Studies, Church Creek, Woolford, Hudson and Lloyds. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
